intro: Tephrosia huillensis var. huillensis, commonly known as the Huillén tephrosia, is a flowering plant native to South America, particularly found in regions of Peru and Ecuador. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, which is characterized by its leguminous properties and nitrogen-fixing capabilities. The plant typically grows in tropical and subtropical climates, thriving in well-drained soils and full sunlight. Its flowers are usually small and clustered, often displaying shades of white or pale yellow, and it produces small, pod-like fruits. This species is of interest to botanists and ecologists due to its ecological role and potential medicinal properties.
